entry.tran: (信息)粗略的，大概的，不完全的，不充分的
entry.def: Sketchy information about something does not include many details and is therefore incomplete or inadequate.

example.ex: Details of what actually happened are still sketchy...
example.tran: 对于已发生事实的详细情况知道的仍然有限。

example.ex: Only sketchy information exists on the stock of natural resources such as fish.
example.tran: 人们对鱼类等自然资源的总储备量所知甚少。

means.word_mean: 1. giving only major points; lacking completeness;

auth_sentence.content: Even so, the rather sketchy results are sobering.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even so, the rather sketchy results are sobering.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even so, the rather sketchy results are sobering.

auth_sentence.content: To begin with, information was sketchy and often conflicting.
auth_sentence.res_content: To begin with, information was sketchy and often conflicting.

auth_sentence.content: Reports of the actual scope of the threat remain sketchy.

means.word_mean: 概要的,不完全的,粗略的

sentences.en: We managed to piece together the truth from several sketchy accounts.
sentences.cn: 我们从几方面粗略的说法中设法弄清了真相。

sentences.en: He only managed to give the police a few sketchy details of the robbery.
sentences.cn: 他只能向警方粗略地描述了抢劫的情况。
